info.title: Microsoft Cognitive Language Service - Analyze Text Authoring
info.description: The language service API is a suite of natural language processing (NLP) skills built with best-in-class Microsoft machine learning algorithms. The API can be used to analyze unstructured text for tasks such as sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction, language detection and question answering. Further documentation can be found in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/language-service/overview.

apim_key.description: A subscription key for a Language service resource.
apim_key.name: Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key

patch.description: Creates a new project or updates an existing one.

200.description: The metadata of the updated project, if it already exists.

201.description: The metadata of the created project.

get.description: Gets the details of a project.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the created job.

post.description: Triggers a job to export a project's data.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the created job.

post.description: Triggers a job to import a project. If a project with the same name already exists, the data of that project is replaced.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the created job.

post.description: Triggers a training job for a project.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the created job.

get.description: Lists the deployments belonging to a project.

post.description: Swaps two existing deployments with each other.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The job object to swap two deployments.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the created job.

get.description: Gets the details of a deployment.

put.description: Creates a new deployment or replaces an existing one.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the created job.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the created job.

get.description: Gets the status of an existing deployment job.
Gets the status of an existing swap deployment job.
Gets the status of an export job. Once job completes, returns the project metadata, and assets.

200.description: The status of the long running operation.

get.description: Gets the status for an import.

200.description: The details of the long running operation.

get.description: Lists the trained models belonging to a project.
Gets the details of a trained model.
Gets the detailed results of the evaluation for a trained model. This includes the raw inference results for the data included in the evaluation process.
Gets the evaluation summary of a trained model. The summary includes high level performance measurements of the model e.g., F1, Precision, Recall, etc.
Lists the non-expired training jobs created for a project.
Gets the status for a training job.

post.description: Triggers a cancellation for a running training job.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the job cancellation.

get.description: Gets the status for a project deletion job.
Lists the support training config version for a given project type.

TextAnalysisAuthoringConfusionMatrixCell.description: Represents a cell in a confusion matrix.

TextAnalysisAuthoringCreateDeploymentOpt.description: Represents the options for creating or updating a project deployment.

TextAnalysisAuthoringCreateProjectOption.description: Represents the options used to create or update a project.

multilingual.description: Whether the project would be used for multiple languages or not.

language.description: The project language. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

TextAnalysisAuthoringCustomEntityRecogni.description: Represents the document evaluation result for a custom entity recognition project.

customEntityRecognitionResult.description: Represents the evaluation prediction for entity recognition.

TextAnalysisAuthoringCustomEntityRecogni.description: Represents the evaluation summary for a custom entity recognition project.

customEntityRecognitionEvaluation.description: Contains the data related to extraction evaluation.

TextAnalysisAuthoringCustomMultiLabelCla.description: Represents the document evaluation result for a custom multi-label classification project.

customMultiLabelClassificationResult.description: Represents the evaluation prediction for multi label classification.

TextAnalysisAuthoringCustomMultiLabelCla.description: Represents the evaluation summary for a custom multi-label classification project.

customMultiLabelClassificationEvaluation.description: Contains the data related to multi label classification evaluation.

TextAnalysisAuthoringCustomSingleLabelCl.description: Represents the document evaluation result for a custom single-label classification project.

customSingleLabelClassificationResult.description: Represents the evaluation prediction for single label classification.

TextAnalysisAuthoringCustomSingleLabelCl.description: Represents the evaluation summary for a custom single-label classification project.

customSingleLabelClassificationEvaluatio.description: Contains the data related to single label classification evaluation.

TextAnalysisAuthoringDocumentEntityLabel.description: Represents an evaluation result entity label.

offset.description: Represents the entity offset index relative to the original text.

TextAnalysisAuthoringDocumentEntityRecog.description: Represents the entity recognition evaluation result for a document.

TextAnalysisAuthoringDocumentEntityRegio.description: Represents the evaluation comparison between the expected and predicted entities of a document region.

expectedEntities.description: Represents the region's expected entity labels.

predictedEntities.description: Represents the region's predicted entity labels.

TextAnalysisAuthoringDocumentEvaluationR.description: Represents the evaluation result of a document.

language.description: Represents the document language. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

TextAnalysisAuthoringDocumentMultiLabelC.description: Represents the comparison between the expected and predicted classes that are result from the evaluation operation.

TextAnalysisAuthoringDocumentSingleLabel.description: Represents the comparison between the expected and predicted class that result from an evaluation operation.

TextAnalysisAuthoringEntityEvaluationSum.description: Represents the evaluation summary for an entity.

truePositiveCount.description: Represents the count of true positive

trueNegativeCount.description: Represents the count of true negative

falsePositiveCount.description: Represents the count of false positive

falseNegativeCount.description: Represents the count of false negative

TextAnalysisAuthoringEntityRecognitionEv.description: Represents the evaluation summary for a custom entity recognition project.

confusionMatrix.description: Represents the confusion matrix between two entities (the two entities can be the same). The matrix is between the entity that was labelled and the entity that was predicted.

values.description: Split the data into training and test sets according to user-defined percentages.
Split the data according to the chosen dataset for every example in the data.

TextAnalysisAuthoringEvaluationOptions.description: Represents the options used running the evaluation.

kind.description: Represents the evaluation kind. By default, the evaluation kind is set to percentage.

trainingSplitPercentage.description: Represents the training dataset split percentage. Only needed in case the evaluation kind is percentage.

testingSplitPercentage.description: Represents the testing dataset split percentage. Only needed in case the evaluation kind is percentage.

TextAnalysisAuthoringEvaluationResults.description: Represents a list of results for an evaluation operation.

value.description: THe list of documents evaluation results.

TextAnalysisAuthoringEvaluationSummary.description: Represents the summary for an evaluation operation.

projectKind.description: Represents the project type that the evaluation ran on.

TextAnalysisAuthoringExportedClass.description: Represents a class of an exported project.

TextAnalysisAuthoringExportedCustomEntit.description: Represents an exported document for a custom entity recognition project.

entities.description: The list of entity labels belonging to the document.

location.description: The location of the document in the storage.

language.description: Represents the document language. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

dataset.description: The dataset for this document. Allowed values are 'Train' and 'Test'.

TextAnalysisAuthoringExportedCustomEntit.description: Represents the exported assets for a entity recognition project.

entities.description: The list of entities belonging to the project.

documents.description: The list of documents belonging to the project.

TextAnalysisAuthoringExportedCustomMulti.description: Represents an exported document of a custom multi-label classification project.

location.description: The location of the document in the storage.

language.description: Represents the document language. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

dataset.description: The dataset for this document. Allowed values are 'Train' and 'Test'.

TextAnalysisAuthoringExportedCustomMulti.description: Represents the exported assets for a custom multi-label classification project.

classes.description: The list of classes in the project.

documents.description: The list of documents in the project.

documents.description: The list of documents belonging to this project.

offset.description: Start position for the entity text.

stringIndexType.description: Specifies the method used to interpret string offsets. For additional information see https://aka.ms/text-analytics-offsets.

TextAnalysisAuthoringExportedProjectAsse.description: Represents the assets of an exported project.

projectKind.description: The type of the project the assets belong to.

expirationDateTime.description: The expiration date time of the job.

warnings.description: The warnings that were encountered while executing the job.

errors.description: The errors encountered while executing the job.

truePositiveCount.description: Represents the count of true positive

trueNegativeCount.description: Represents the count of true negative

falsePositiveCount.description: Represents the count of false positive

falseNegativeCount.description: Represents the count of false negative

TextAnalysisAuthoringMultiLabelClassific.description: Represents the evaluation summary for a multi-label classification project.

deploymentExpirationDate.description: Represents deployment expiration date in the runtime.

TextAnalysisAuthoringProjectDeployments.description: Represents a list of retrieved deployments.

values.description: For building a classification model to classify text using your own data. Each file will have only one label. For example, file 1 is classified as A and file 2 is classified as B.
For building a classification model to classify text using your own data. Each file can have one or many labels. For example, file 1 is classified as A, B, and C and file 2 is classified as B and C.
For building an extraction model to identify your domain categories using your own data.

TextAnalysisAuthoringProjectMetadata.description: Represents the metadata of a project.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: Represents the project last modification datetime.

lastTrainedDateTime.description: Represents the project last training datetime.

lastDeployedDateTime.description: Represents the project last deployment datetime.

multilingual.description: Whether the project would be used for multiple languages or not.

language.description: The project language. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

TextAnalysisAuthoringProjectSettings.description: Represents the settings used to define the project behavior.

TextAnalysisAuthoringProjectsMetadata.description: Represents a list of retrieved projects' metadata.

lastTrainedDateTime.description: The last trained date time of the model.

lastTrainingDurationInSeconds.description: The duration of the model's last training request in seconds.

TextAnalysisAuthoringProjectTrainedModel.description: Represents a list of retrieved trained models.

TextAnalysisAuthoringSingleLabelClassEva.description: Represents the evaluation summary for a class in a single-label classification project.

truePositiveCount.description: Represents the count of true positive

trueNegativeCount.description: Represents the count of true negative

falsePositiveCount.description: Represents the count of false positive

falseNegativeCount.description: Represents the count of false negative

confusionMatrix.description: Represents the confusion matrix between two classes (the two classes can be the same). The matrix is between the class that was labelled and the class that was predicted.

values.description: The offset and length values will correspond to UTF-16 code units. Use this option if your application is written in a language that support Unicode, for example Java, JavaScript.

TextAnalysisAuthoringSubTrainingJobState.description: Represents the detailed state of a training sub-operation.

status.description: Represents the status of the sub-operation.

languageCode.description: The language code. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

TextAnalysisAuthoringSwapDeploymentsOpti.description: Represents the options for swapping two deployments together.

trainingConfigVersion.description: Represents the version of the config.

modelExpirationDate.description: Represents the training config version expiration date.

TextAnalysisAuthoringTrainingConfigVersi.description: Represents a list of training config versions.

value.description: The list of the training config versions.

TextAnalysisAuthoringTrainingJobOptions.description: Represents the options for starting a new training job.

evaluationOptions.description: Represents the evaluation options. By default, the evaluation kind is percentage, with training split percentage as 80, and testing split percentage as 20.

TextAnalysisAuthoringTrainingJobResult.description: Represents the output of a training job.

estimatedEndDateTime.description: Represents the estimate end date time for training and evaluation.

TextAnalysisAuthoringTrainingJobs.description: Represents a list of retrieved training jobs.

TextAnalysisAuthoringTrainingJobState.description: Represents the state of a training job.

TextAnalysisAuthoringWarning.description: Represents a warning that was encountered while executing the request.

TextAnalysisAuthoringStringIndexTypeQuer.name: stringIndexType
TextAnalysisAuthoringStringIndexTypeQuer.description: Specifies the method used to interpret string offsets. For additional information see https://aka.ms/text-analytics-offsets.

values.description: The offset and length values will correspond to UTF-16 code units. Use this option if your application is written in a language that support Unicode, for example Java, JavaScript.
For building a classification model to classify text using your own data. Each file will have only one label. For example, file 1 is classified as A and file 2 is classified as B.
For building a classification model to classify text using your own data. Each file can have one or many labels. For example, file 1 is classified as A, B, and C and file 2 is classified as B and C.
For building an extraction model to identify your domain categories using your own data.
